# Government Contact Centre Services (GCCS) Request for Proposal
## Overview
Government Contact Centre Services (GCCS) is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) for Contact Centre as a Service (CCaaS) Supply Arrangement (SA). The RFP is open to selected supply arrangement holders who have qualified under the GCCS programme.

## Background
The Benefits Delivery Modernization (BDM) programme is transforming the way the Government of Canada delivers benefits. The BDM programme aims to modernize the service experience for Canadians, ensuring they are at the core of the services provided. The programme will deliver a world-class service experience through the use of modern technology.

## Scope of Work
The successful supplier will provide a Contact Centre Solution (CCS) that enables Employment and Social Development Canada (ESDC) to deliver a seamless, omnichannel service experience. The CCS must be able to handle a high volume of interactions and provide real-time data analytics.

## Key Requirements

* Scalability: The CCS must be able to handle a high volume of interactions and expand seamlessly to meet changing business needs.
* Data Security: The CCS must ensure the secure handling of sensitive data, meeting all government security standards.
* Interoperability: The CCS must integrate with existing ESDC systems and applications.

## Evaluation Criteria
Proposals will be evaluated on the following criteria:

* Technical approach
* Solution features
* Security measures
* Interoperability with existing ESDC systems
* Cost and value for money

## Timeline

* RFP issuance: November 2022
* Vendor Engagement Day: December 5, 2022
* Proposal submission deadline: January 11, 2023 (13:00 EST)
